text: Making the Sauce Heat oil in a pan.  Fry onions until golden.  Add the bacon, garlic, salt, pepper and minced meat.  Stir well and cook for 15 minutes.  Add the tomato puree, stock and the bay leaf.  Grate in some nutmeg.  Simmer (covered) for 30 minutes.  Then simmer uncovered for another 30 minutes.  Remove any discoloured parts from the chicken livers.  Chop into large chunks.  Fry with a bit of butter.  Cool.  Remove any stringy bits.  Putting it Together Boil the macaroni in salty water until firm but not hard (al dente)  Pour a cup of cold water into the pan as soon as the pasta is cooked..  It is important it remains underdone so that it will retain its shape and texture at the end.  Drain.  Mix into the meat and tomato.  Add the eggs, the cheese and season.  Mix well.  Leave to cool.  Put in a layer of macaroni and meat then a layer of chicken livers into a large oven proof dish.  Cover with the macaroni.  Cover with the pastry.  Glaze with the egg  Bake at 220C for 15 minutes.  Reduce heat to 180C cook for 30 minutes.  Finished.
